intro: Hieracium cephalotes subsp. cephalotes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and rhizomatous. This subspecies is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
